name: Kerr Lake Catfish Stew
author: LPK
summary: When my children were young, we camped most weekends in the summer. Saturday night was usually 'catfish night' with fish straight from the lake into the pot or pan. This was a real quickie favorite.
ingredients: 6 dashes hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®), or to taste
2 pounds catfish, cut into bite-sized pieces
directions: Place the bacon in a Dutch oven or a large pot with a lid; cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes
Reserving the drippings in the skillet, remove the bacon to a plate lined with paper towels to drain
Crumble the bacon and set aside
Put the onions in the pot; cover and allow to cook about 5 minutes
Stir the tomatoes, tomato sauce, potatoes, Worcestershire sauce, and hot pepper sauce into the onions
Season with salt and pepper; allow to simmer 30 minutes
Stir the crumbled bacon and catfish into the mixture; continue cooking until the fish flakes easily, about 10 minutes more
